meanings.definition: A radical republican in France, typically a member of the working class, who supported the French Revolution.
meanings.sent1: The sansculottes demanded equality and justice for all.
meanings.sent2: During the French Revolution, the sansculottes played a significant role in advocating for change.
meanings.sent3: The sansculottes walked proudly through the streets, their voices raised in unity.
meanings.sent4: In the historical play, the sansculottes were portrayed as fearless champions of the people.
meanings.sent5: The image of the sansculottes marching with determination left a lasting impression on the crowd.

meanings.definition: A style of dress characterized by loose-fitting trousers instead of knee breeches.
meanings.sent1: She chose to wear sansculottes to the party for a comfortable and casual look.
meanings.sent2: The fashion designer introduced a new line of sansculottes for the upcoming season.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, his choice of sansculottes raised a few eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: Her rebellious spirit was reflected in her preference for sansculottes over traditional attire.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the sansculottes swirled around her legs as she danced under the moonlight.
